page.title: 11Natural History (woodlands)
page.content:
There is an abundance of wildlife in the area. A herd of about 60{wild deer roam the woodlands - their numbers have to be controlled to reduce the damage they do.
Amongst the butterflies that may be found are the{Holly Blue,}which over the last few years has become quite rare.
The area attracts a wide variety of birdlife, not only those associated with the countryside but also species most often seen in towns.
The heavy marl soil gives good growing conditions for most plants but makes it hard work for gardeners! Spring time is a delight for flower lovers, with lots of violets, wood anemones, primroses and bluebells.
